meanings.definition: A person who is skilled in public speaking and delivering speeches.
meanings.sent1: The elocutionists captivated the audience with their powerful speeches.
meanings.sent2: Many elocutionists compete in speech contests to showcase their talents.
meanings.sent3: The elocutionists decided to have a friendly competition to see who could speak the loudest.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was like that of an elocutionist, commanding attention and respect.
meanings.sent5: The elocutionists practiced tirelessly to perfect their delivery and gestures.

meanings.definition: The art of public speaking and delivering speeches.
meanings.sent1: Studying elocutionists can help improve your own public speaking skills.
meanings.sent2: The history of elocutionists dates back to ancient times.
meanings.sent3: The elocutionists' club met every week to discuss new speech techniques.
meanings.sent4: His eloquence was reminiscent of the great elocutionists of the past.
meanings.sent5: Attending workshops led by elocutionists can boost your confidence on stage.
